required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Limiting Adverse Birth Outcomes in Resource-Limited Settings
clinical_study.official_title: Limiting Adverse Birth Outcomes in Resource-Limited Settings - The LABOR Study

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this research is to exhaustively document the labor, delivery, and early postpartum course of 15,000 mother-newborn pairs in settings where the occurrence of adverse birth outcomes is high. The Investigators will gather detailed laboratory, physiologic, and clinical information, and precisely characterize major adverse diagnoses and outcomes. The resulting high-quality, granular, and generalizable data will be used to develop new algorithms to signal actionable intrapartum diagnoses and prospectively stratify women according to their risk for adverse maternal and neonatal outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective multi-country cohort study of 15,000 women in labor and their newborns. Women will be recruited and screened for study participation at the time of presentation to the hospital labor unit. Participants will be assessed through labor, delivery, and discharge and at 7- and 42-day postpartum phone calls. Liveborn infants will be enrolled at birth and followed through 42 days of life. The pilot phase of this protocol will enroll up to 500 women in labor and their newborns and follow them through labor, delivery, and 42 days postpartum.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of cases of maternal death or severe morbidity
primary_outcome.description: Maternal composite: The combined number of maternal death or incident severe morbidity arising from hemorrhage, hypertension, or infection

primary_outcome.measure: Number of cases of neonatal death or severe morbidity
primary_outcome.description: Fetal/Neonatal Composite: The combined number of Intrapartum stillbirths, neonatal deaths, neonatal encephalopathy, or neonatal sepsis

arm_group.description: 15,000 pregnant women and their fetuses/newborns (including a pilot phase of up to 500 participant pairs)

intervention.description: Documentation of course and outcome of labor, delivery, and postpartum period

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women and their fetuses/newborns at the Women and Newborn Hospital of the University Teaching Hospital in Lusaka, Zambia, Korle-bu Teaching Hospital in Accra, Ghana, and Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College Women's and Children's Health Research Unit, KLE Academy of Higher Education and Research in Belagavi, Karnataka India, and Fakir Mohan Medical College and Hospital in Balasore, Odisha, India.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria for women enrolled:
- Maternal age of majority
- Intrauterine singleton pregnancy
- Admission to hospital labor and delivery unit with intent of vaginal delivery
- Ability and willingness to provide written informed consent
- Willingness to adhere to study procedures
- Willingness to provide locator information for follow-up
Exclusion Criteria for women enrolled:
- Planned cesarean delivery at the time of admission
- Any condition (social or medical) which, in the opinion of study staff, would make participation unsafe or not feasible

overall_official.affiliation: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

facility.name: Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College Women's and Children's Health Research Unit, KLE Academy of Higher Education and Research
Fakir Mohan Medical College and Hospital
Women and Newborn Hospital at University Teaching Hospital

patient_data.ipd_description: Deidentified individual data that support the study results will be shared within 6 months of the publication of primary results. As this is a multi-country study with data sharing governed by multiple research ethics and governmental oversight entities, data sharing will be subject to each country providing individual approval in accordance with its own local regulatory requirements.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Deidentified individual data that supports the study results will be shared within 6 months of the publication of primary results.
